__GlobalAccessControlManaged_init(addres.details: this is assumed to be used in the initializer of the inhereiting contract

params._globalAccessControl: global access control which is pinged to allow / deny access to permissioned calls by role

claimAssetToTreasury().details: We let assets accumulate and batch transfer to treasury (rather than transfer atomically on each deposi)t for user gas savings

params._minCitadelOut: ID of DAO to vote for

returns.limitLeft_: Amount of `asset` that can still be exchanged for citadel

returns.xCitadelAmount_: Amount of `xCitadel` received at current price per share

params._asset: The token this contract will receive in a trade
params._assetCap: The max asset that the contract can take
params._citadel: The token this contract will return in a trade
params._saleRecipient: The address receiving the proceeds of the sale - will be citadel multisig
params._xCitadel: Staked citadel, citadel will be granted to funders in this form

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

setAssetCap(uint256).details: This is cumulative asset cap, so must take into account the asset amount already funded.

setDiscount(uint256).details: managed by policy operations for rapid response to market conditions

setDiscountLimits(uint256,uint256).details: managed by contract governance to place constraints around the parameter for policy operations to play within

setDiscountManager(address).details: This is intended to be used for an automated discount manager contract to supplement or replace manual calls

sweep(address).details: The contract transfers all `asset` directly to `saleRecipient` during a sale so it's safe      to sweep `asset`. For `citadel`, the function only sweeps the extra amount      (current contract balance - amount left to be claimed)

updateCitadelPriceInAsset().details: Note that the oracle mechanics are abstracted to the oracle address

updateCitadelPriceInAsset(uint256).details: OUT OF AUDIT SCOPE: This is a test function that will be removed in final codeNote that the oracle mechanics are abstracted to the oracle address

asset().notice: wrapped citadel form that is actually distributed

assetDecimalsNormalizationValue().notice: Flag citadel price for review by guardian if it exceeds min and max bounds;

citadelPriceFlag().notice: Upper bound on expected citadel price in asset terms. Used as circuit breaker oracle.

citadelPriceInAsset().notice: token to take in WBTC / bibbtc LP / CVX / bveCVX

claimAssetToTreasury().notice: Claim accumulated asset token to treasury

getAmountOut(uint256).notice: Get the amount received when exchanging `asset`

getDiscount().notice: Convenience function to get current discount rate

getRemainingFundable().notice: Check how much `asset` can still be taken in, based on cap and cumulative amount funded

getStakedCitadelAmountOut(uint256).notice: Get the amount received when exchanging `asset`, in terms of xCitadel at current price per share

maxCitadelPriceInAsset().notice: Lower bound on expected citadel price in asset terms. Used as circuit breaker oracle.

minCitadelPriceInAsset().notice: asset per citadel price eg. 1 WBTC (8 decimals) = 40,000 CTDL ==> price = 10^8 / 40,000

setAssetCap(uint256).notice: Modify the max asset amount that this contract can take. Managed by policy governance.

setDiscount(uint256).notice: Set discount manually, within the constraints of min and max discount values

sweep(address).notice: Transfers out any tokens accidentally sent to the contract. Can only be called by owner

updateCitadelPriceInAsset().notice: Update citadel price in asset terms from oracle source

updateCitadelPriceInAsset(uint256).notice: Update citadel price in asset terms from oracle source
